clues.text: Waxing poetic for his homeland, Liam Neeson voiced a recent tourism ad urging us to "discover" this U.K. country

This actor's oddly zenlike ads for Lincoln autos have been widely parodied
Slipping into a deal with these jeans has made Dale Earnhardt Jr. a well-paid celebrity endorser
Charlize Theron did a striking ad for the perfume "J'adore" this brand
This 14th century "Tales" teller & poet penned the prose work "A Treatise on the Astrolabe"
This author's "The Diamond Smugglers" is nonfiction, but it's about a British secret agent who uses gadgets
F. Scott Fitzgerald wrote 17 "Pat Hobby" stories about a down-&-out one of these writers, a job Scott knew well
Along with his doggone novels, he wrote "That Spot", a short story about a faithful dog
"Dracula" author Bram Stoker also wrote about "The Lair of" this pale monster
In 1980 the U.S. & 64 other countries boycotted the Olympics held in this city
This city hosted the Summer Games in 1964, a first for Asia
In 2006, 30 years late, the debt was paid off for the stadium called "The Big Owe" & the rest of this city's games
This city between Lake Malaren & the Baltic Sea hosted the 1912 Olympics
It took until 1956, but finally a Southern Hemisphere city hosted--this one
Built around 1703, this royal residence is fit for a "king"

Daredevil's enemy, or the chief person in an operation
Searching for & exposing scandal in politics
Equine term for anything that hides the real plan

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be two words, one the reverse of the other.)

clues.text: A canned Hormel product spelled backwards becomes items that can help you find your way home
Shelled snacks become a verb meaning to daze
Forwards, a tuber; backwards, a month
A roll sometimes "hot cross" becomes a small lump
An onion relative turns into a part of a boat
Pope's line "A little" this "is a dangerous thing" is sometimes misquoted as "A little knowledge"
Although he knew little Greek, Pope took on the task of translating these 2 Homeric works
Pope wrote "Nature and nature's laws lay hid in night: God said, let" this scientist "be! and all was light"
This poem was based on an incident in which Lord Petre cut the tresses of Arabella Fermor
Pope added a 9th of these "to the 8 in the scripture; blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed"

Celia Cruz was "The Queen of" this saucy music & dance style
This Led Zeppelin drummer was known as "The Beast" as well as "Bonzo"

William Collins, better known as this, passed the nickname tradition on by dubbing Kenneth Edmonds "Babyface"
With 60 million, it's the most populous island in Europe
These 2 islands combine to make a total of 6.5 million Italians
This island of 6 million is shared between one nation & part o' another
Some consider this island nation of 1 million to be in Asia, some in Europe

6-letter word meaning to make someone angry

rounds.text: Its 25th anniversary, Aug. 13, 1986, was celebrated with parades to the east & mourning to the west
